One of these people could be CT's next top prosecutor. Here's how they answered our questions.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Right now, Connecticut is looking for its next Chief State's Attorney. As the most powerful prosecutor in Connecticut, the Chief State's Attorney has the power to align prosecutors' budgets, policies, and lobbying to prioritize strong communities and racial justice instead of incarceration and the status quo – or not.

Before Connecticut picks its next Chief State's Attorney, it's critical that people know where applicants stand on decarceration and racial justice. Smart Justice asked every applicant for their views on 17 policies. Read their responses on our website.

This week, four Chief State's Attorney applicants become finalists for the position. All four answered our questions, and one of them could be the next Chief State's Attorney. Learn where they stand.

The ACLU of Connecticut, including the Smart Justice campaign, doesn't endorse or oppose applicants for the Chief State's Attorney position, and we aren't endorsing any now. We're ready to hold the next Chief State's Attorney – whoever that is – accountable for their role in ending mass incarceration.

In solidarity,

ACLU of Connecticut Smart Justice Team
